message_history.content:
Answer the given question. You must conduct reasoning inside <think> and </think> first every time you get new information. After reasoning, if you find you lack some knowledge, you can call a search engine by <search> query </search> and it will return the top searched results between <information> and </information>. You can search as many times as your want. If you find no further external knowledge needed, you can directly provide the answer inside <answer> and </answer>, without detailed illustrations. For example, <answer> Beijing </answer>. Question: Curious about the birth rate, death rate, and the overall population of the United States. Please gather the following information on yearly basis from 2012-2023 (including 2012 and 2023). 

Please organize the results in one Markdown table with the following columns:
Year, Total Population(Million), Male Population(Million), Female Population(Million), Birth Rate, Death Rate
Note: both birth rate and death rate indicate the number of live births/deaths occurring during the year, per 1,000 population. 

Don't ask me any questions, just output the results according to the columns without omitting cells arbitrarily. The output format is ```markdown
{data_content}
```.?

To gather the required information on yearly basis from 2012 to 2023 for the United States regarding Total Population (in Millions), Male Population (in Millions), Female Population (in Millions), Birth Rate (per 1,000 population), and Death Rate (per 1,000 population), I will use an online resource like the US Census Bureau or another reliable source.

<search>United States birth rate death rate population 2012-2023</search>

Search query: United States birth rate death rate population 2012-2023
Result: [Doc 1](https://www.cdc.gov/nchs/data-visualization/birth-to-death-ratios/natality-mortality-trends.htm):
Natality and Mortality Trends in the United States, 2000–2023 - CDC These charts describe trends in births and deaths in the United States from 2000 through the most current available year.

[Doc 2](https://www.macrotrends.net/global-metrics/countries/usa/united-states/birth-rate):
U.S. Birth Rate (1950-2025) - Macrotrends U.S. birth rate for 2024 was 12.01, a 12.23% increase from 2023. · U.S. birth rate for 2023 was 10.70, a 2.73% decline from 2022. · U.S. birth rate for 2022 was ...

[Doc 3](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK618135/):
Trends in Births and Deaths: United States, 2010–2023 - NCBI - NIH From 2019 through 2023, deaths fluctuated, with the number rising 14% from 2019 to 2020 (2,484,072) and 2.6% in 2021 (2,548,809), but then ...

Based on the available data:

<search>United States Total Population Male Female Birth Death Rates 2012-2023</search>

Search query: United States Total Population Male Female Birth Death Rates 2012-2023
Result: [Doc 1](https://www.cdc.gov/nchs/data-visualization/birth-to-death-ratios/natality-mortality-trends.htm):
Natality and Mortality Trends in the United States, 2000–2023 - CDC These charts describe trends in births and deaths in the United States from 2000 through the most current available year.

[Doc 2](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK618135/):
Trends in Births and Deaths: United States, 2010–2023 - NCBI - NIH The number of deaths fluctuated from 2019 through 2023, with deaths rising 44% from 2019 to 2020 (305,708) and 3.3% in 2021 (315,664), but then ...

[Doc 3](https://www.census.gov/library/stories/2023/12/state-population-estimates.html):
Births Now Outpacing Deaths in Over Half the States New population estimates show that 19 states had more deaths than births in 2023, down from 25 in 2022.
